info.title: PostHog JavaScript Web SDK
info.description: Posthog-js allows you to automatically capture usage and send events to PostHog.

classes.description:
This is the SDK reference for the PostHog JavaScript Web SDK. You can learn more about example usage in the [JavaScript Web SDK documentation](/docs/libraries/js). You can also follow [framework specific guides](/docs/frameworks) to integrate PostHog into your project.
This SDK is designed for browser environments. Use the PostHog [Node.js SDK](/docs/libraries/node) for server-side usage.
classes.title: PostHog

functions.description: Creates an alias linking two distinct user identifiers. Learn more about [identifying users](/docs/product-analytics/identify)
functions.details: PostHog will use this to link two distinct_ids going forward (not retroactively). Call this when a user signs up to connect their anonymous session with their account.
functions.title: alias

examples.name: link anonymous user to account on signup
examples.code:
// link anonymous user to account on signup
posthog.alias('user_12345')

examples.name: explicit alias with original ID
examples.code:
// explicit alias with original ID
posthog.alias('user_12345', 'anonymous_abc123')

params.description: A unique identifier that you want to use for this user in the future.
params.name: alias

params.description: The current identifier being used for this user.
params.name: original

functions.description: Checks the feature flags associated with this Survey to see if the survey can be rendered. This method is deprecated because it's synchronous and won't return the correct result if surveys are not loaded. Use `canRenderSurveyAsync` instead.
functions.title: canRenderSurvey

examples.name: Generated example for canRenderSurvey
examples.code:
// Generated example for canRenderSurvey
posthog.canRenderSurvey();

params.description: The ID of the survey to check.
params.name: surveyId

functions.description: Checks the feature flags associated with this Survey to see if the survey can be rendered.
functions.title: canRenderSurveyAsync

params.description: The ID of the survey to check.
params.name: surveyId

params.description: If true, the survey will be reloaded from the server, Default: false
params.name: forceReload

functions.description: Captures an event with optional properties and configuration.
functions.details: You can capture arbitrary object-like values as events. [Learn about capture best practices](/docs/product-analytics/capture-events)
functions.title: capture

examples.name: basic event capture

params.description: The name of the event (e.g., 'Sign Up', 'Button Click', 'Purchase')
params.name: event_name

params.description: Properties to include with the event describing the user or event details
params.name: properties

params.description: Optional configuration for the capture request
params.name: options

functions.description: Capture a caught exception manually
functions.title: captureException

examples.name: Capture a caught exception
With additional properties

params.description: The error to capture
params.name: error

params.description: Any additional properties to add to the error event
params.name: additionalProperties

functions.description: Capture written user feedback for a LLM trace. Numeric values are converted to strings.
functions.title: captureTraceFeedback

examples.name: Generated example for captureTraceFeedback
examples.code:
// Generated example for captureTraceFeedback
posthog.captureTraceFeedback();

params.description: The trace ID to capture feedback for.
params.name: traceId

params.description: The feedback to capture.
params.name: userFeedback

functions.description: Capture a metric for a LLM trace. Numeric values are converted to strings.
functions.title: captureTraceMetric

examples.name: Generated example for captureTraceMetric
examples.code:
// Generated example for captureTraceMetric
posthog.captureTraceMetric();

params.description: The trace ID to capture the metric for.
params.name: traceId

params.description: The name of the metric to capture.
params.name: metricName

params.description: The value of the metric to capture.
params.name: metricValue

functions.description: Clear the user's opt in/out status of data capturing and cookies/localstorage for this PostHog instance
functions.title: clear_opt_in_out_capturing

examples.name: Generated example for clear_opt_in_out_capturing
examples.code:
// Generated example for clear_opt_in_out_capturing
posthog.clear_opt_in_out_capturing();

functions.description: Creates a person profile for the current user, if they don't already have one and config.person_profiles is set to 'identified_only'. Produces a warning and does not create a profile if config.person_profiles is set to 'never'. Learn more about [person profiles](/docs/product-analytics/identify)
functions.title: createPersonProfile

examples.code: posthog.createPersonProfile()

functions.description: Enables or disables debug mode for detailed logging.
functions.details: Debug mode logs all PostHog calls to the browser console for troubleshooting. Can also be enabled by adding `?__posthog_debug=true` to the URL.
functions.title: debug

examples.name: enable debug mode
examples.code:
// enable debug mode
posthog.debug(true)

examples.name: disable debug mode
examples.code:
// disable debug mode
posthog.debug(false)

params.description: If true, will enable debug mode.
params.name: debug

functions.description: Returns the current distinct ID for the user.
functions.details: This is either the auto-generated ID or the ID set via `identify()`. The distinct ID is used to associate events with users in PostHog.
functions.title: get_distinct_id

examples.name: get the current user ID
use in loaded callback

functions.description: Returns the value of a super property. Returns undefined if the property doesn't exist.
functions.details: get_property() can only be called after the PostHog library has finished loading. init() has a loaded function available to handle this automatically.
functions.title: get_property

examples.name: grab value for '$user_id' after the posthog library has loaded

params.description: The name of the super property you want to retrieve
params.name: property_name

functions.description: Returns the current session_id.
functions.details: This should only be used for informative purposes. Any actual internal use case for the session_id should be handled by the sessionManager.
functions.title: get_session_id

examples.name: Generated example for get_session_id
examples.code:
// Generated example for get_session_id
posthog.get_session_id();

functions.description: Returns the Replay url for the current session.
functions.title: get_session_replay_url

examples.name: basic usage

params.description: Options for the url
params.name: options

functions.description: Get surveys that should be enabled for the current user. See [fetching surveys documentation](/docs/surveys/implementing-custom-surveys#fetching-surveys-manually) for more details.
functions.title: getActiveMatchingSurveys

params.description: The callback function will be called when the surveys are loaded or updated.
params.name: callback

params.description: Whether to force a reload of the surveys.
params.name: forceReload

functions.description: Get the list of early access features. To check enrollment status, use `isFeatureEnabled`. [Learn more in the docs](/docs/feature-flags/early-access-feature-management#option-2-custom-implementation)
functions.title: getEarlyAccessFeatures

params.description: The callback function will be called when the early access features are loaded.
params.name: callback

params.description: Whether to force a reload of the early access features.
params.name: force_reload

params.description: The stages of the early access features to load.
params.name: stages

functions.description: Gets the value of a feature flag for the current user.
functions.details: Returns the feature flag value which can be a boolean, string, or undefined. Supports multivariate flags that can return custom string values.
functions.title: getFeatureFlag

examples.name: check boolean flag
check multivariate flag

params.description: (optional) If send_event: false, we won't send an $feature_flag_call event to PostHog.
params.name: options

functions.description: Get feature flag payload value matching key for user (supports multivariate flags).
functions.title: getFeatureFlagPayload

functions.description: Returns the current groups.
functions.title: getGroups

examples.name: Generated example for getGroups
examples.code:
// Generated example for getGroups
posthog.getGroups();

functions.description: Returns the current page view ID.
functions.title: getPageViewId

examples.name: Generated example for getPageViewId
examples.code:
// Generated example for getPageViewId
posthog.getPageViewId();

functions.description: Returns the value of the session super property named property_name. If no such property is set, getSessionProperty() will return the undefined value.
functions.details: This is based on browser-level `sessionStorage`, NOT the PostHog session. getSessionProperty() can only be called after the PostHog library has finished loading. init() has a loaded function available to handle this automatically.
functions.title: getSessionProperty

examples.name: grab value for 'user_id' after the posthog library has loaded

params.description: The name of the session super property you want to retrieve
params.name: property_name

functions.description: Get list of all surveys.
functions.title: getSurveys

params.description: Function that receives the array of surveys
params.name: callback

params.description: Optional boolean to force an API call for updated surveys
params.name: forceReload

functions.description: Associates the user with a group for group-based analytics. Learn more about [groups](/docs/product-analytics/group-analytics)
functions.details: Groups allow you to analyze users collectively (e.g., by organization, team, or account). This sets the group association for all subsequent events and reloads feature flags.
functions.title: group

examples.name: associate user with an organization
associate with multiple group types

params.description: Group type (example: 'organization')
params.name: groupType

params.description: Group key (example: 'org::5')
params.name: groupKey

params.description: Optional properties to set for group
params.name: groupPropertiesToSet

functions.description: Checks if the user has opted into data capturing.
functions.details: Returns the current consent status for event tracking and data persistence.
functions.title: has_opted_in_capturing

functions.description: Checks if the user has opted out of data capturing.
functions.details: Returns the current consent status for event tracking and data persistence.
functions.title: has_opted_out_capturing

functions.description: Associates a user with a unique identifier instead of an auto-generated ID. Learn more about [identifying users](/docs/product-analytics/identify)
functions.details: By default, PostHog assigns each user a randomly generated `distinct_id`. Use this method to replace that ID with your own unique identifier (like a user ID from your database).
functions.title: identify

examples.name: basic identification
examples.code:
// basic identification
posthog.identify('user_12345')

examples.name: identify with user properties
identify with set and set_once properties

params.description: A string that uniquely identifies a user. If not provided, the distinct_id currently in the persistent store (cookie or localStorage) will be used.
params.name: new_distinct_id

params.description: Optional: An associative array of properties to store about the user. Note: For feature flag evaluations, if the same key is present in the userPropertiesToSetOnce, it will be overwritten by the value in userPropertiesToSet.
params.name: userPropertiesToSet

params.description: Optional: An associative array of properties to store about the user. If property is previously set, this does not override that value.
params.name: userPropertiesToSetOnce

functions.description: Initializes a new instance of the PostHog capturing object.
functions.details: All new instances are added to the main posthog object as sub properties (such as `posthog.library_name`) and also returned by this function. [Learn more about configuration options](https://github.com/posthog/posthog-js/blob/6e0e873/src/posthog-core.js#L57-L91)
functions.title: init

examples.name: basic initialization
multiple instances

params.description: Your PostHog API token
params.name: token

params.description: A dictionary of config options to override
params.name: config

params.description: The name for the new posthog instance that you want created
params.name: name

functions.description:
Checks whether the PostHog library is currently capturing events.
Usually this means that the user has not opted out of capturing, but the exact behaviour can be controlled by some config options.
Additionally, if the cookieless_mode is set to 'on_reject', we will capture events in cookieless mode if the user has explicitly opted out.
functions.title: is_capturing

examples.name: Generated example for is_capturing
examples.code:
// Generated example for is_capturing
posthog.is_capturing();

functions.description: Checks if a feature flag is enabled for the current user.
functions.details: Returns true if the flag is enabled, false if disabled, or undefined if not found. This is a convenience method that treats any truthy value as enabled.
functions.title: isFeatureEnabled

examples.name: simple feature flag check
disable event tracking

params.description: (optional) If send_event: false, we won't send an $feature_flag_call event to PostHog.
params.name: options

functions.description: returns a boolean indicating whether the [toolbar](/docs/toolbar) loaded
functions.title: loadToolbar

examples.name: Generated example for loadToolbar
examples.code:
// Generated example for loadToolbar
posthog.loadToolbar();

functions.description:
Exposes a set of events that PostHog will emit. e.g. `eventCaptured` is emitted immediately before trying to send an event
Unlike `onFeatureFlags` and `onSessionId` these are not called when the listener is registered, the first callback will be the next event _after_ registering a listener
functions.title: on

params.description: The event to listen for.
params.name: event

params.description: The callback function to call when the event is emitted.
params.name: cb

functions.description: Register an event listener that runs when feature flags become available or when they change. If there are flags, the listener is called immediately in addition to being called on future changes. Note that this is not called only when we fetch feature flags from the server, but also when they change in the browser.
functions.title: onFeatureFlags

params.description: The callback function will be called once the feature flags are ready or when they are updated. It'll return a list of feature flags enabled for the user, the variants, and also a context object indicating whether we succeeded to fetch the flags or not.
params.name: callback

functions.description:
Register an event listener that runs whenever the session id or window id change. If there is already a session id, the listener is called immediately in addition to being called on future changes.
Can be used, for example, to sync the PostHog session id with a backend session.
functions.title: onSessionId

examples.code: posthog.onSessionId(function(sessionId, windowId) { // do something })

params.description: The callback function will be called once a session id is present or when it or the window id are updated.
params.name: callback

functions.description:
Register an event listener that runs when surveys are loaded.
Callback parameters: - surveys: Survey[]: An array containing all survey objects fetched from PostHog using the getSurveys method - context:  isLoaded: boolean, error?: string : An object indicating if the surveys were loaded successfully
functions.title: onSurveysLoaded

examples.code: posthog.onSurveysLoaded((surveys, context) => { // do something })

params.description: The callback function will be called when surveys are loaded or updated.
params.name: callback

functions.description: Opts the user into data capturing and persistence.
functions.details: Enables event tracking and data persistence (cookies/localStorage) for this PostHog instance. By default, captures an `$opt_in` event unless disabled.
functions.title: opt_in_capturing

examples.name: simple opt-in
examples.code:
// simple opt-in
posthog.opt_in_capturing()

examples.name: opt-in with custom event and properties
opt-in without capturing event

params.name: options

functions.description: Opts the user out of data capturing and persistence.
functions.details: Disables event tracking and data persistence (cookies/localStorage) for this PostHog instance. If `opt_out_persistence_by_default` is true, SDK persistence will also be disabled.
functions.title: opt_out_capturing

examples.name: opt user out (e.g., on privacy settings page)
examples.code:
// opt user out (e.g., on privacy settings page)
posthog.opt_out_capturing()

functions.description: push() keeps the standard async-array-push behavior around after the lib is loaded. This is only useful for external integrations that do not wish to rely on our convenience methods (created in the snippet).
functions.title: push

examples.code: posthog.push(['register', { a: 'b' }]);

params.description: A [function_name, args...] array to be executed
params.name: item

functions.description: Registers super properties for the current session only.
functions.details: Session super properties are automatically added to all events during the current browser session. Unlike regular super properties, these are cleared when the session ends and are stored in sessionStorage.
functions.title: register_for_session

examples.name: register session-specific properties
register properties for user flow tracking

params.description: An associative array of properties to store about the user
params.name: properties

functions.description: Registers super properties only if they haven't been set before.
functions.details: Unlike `register()`, this method will not overwrite existing super properties. Use this for properties that should only be set once, like signup date or initial referrer.
functions.title: register_once

examples.name: register once-only properties
override existing value if it matches default

params.description: An associative array of properties to store about the user
params.name: properties

params.description: Value to override if already set in super properties (ex: 'False') Default: 'None'
params.name: default_value

params.description: How many days since the users last visit to store the super properties
params.name: days

functions.description: Registers super properties that are included with all events.
functions.details: Super properties are stored in persistence and automatically added to every event you capture. These values will overwrite any existing super properties with the same keys.
functions.title: register

examples.name: register a single property
examples.code:
// register a single property
posthog.register({ plan: 'premium' })

examples.name: register multiple properties
register with custom expiration
examples.code:
// register with custom expiration
posthog.register({ campaign: 'summer_sale' }, 7) // expires in 7 days

params.description: properties to store about the user
params.name: properties

params.description: How many days since the user's last visit to store the super properties
params.name: days

functions.description: Feature flag values are cached. If something has changed with your user and you'd like to refetch their flag values, call this method.
functions.title: reloadFeatureFlags

examples.code: posthog.reloadFeatureFlags()

functions.description:
Although we recommend using popover surveys and display conditions, if you want to show surveys programmatically without setting up all the extra logic needed for API surveys, you can render surveys programmatically with the renderSurvey method.
This takes a survey ID and an HTML selector to render an unstyled survey.
functions.title: renderSurvey

examples.code: posthog.renderSurvey(coolSurveyID, '#survey-container')

params.description: The ID of the survey to render.
params.name: surveyId

params.description: The selector of the HTML element to render the survey on.
params.name: selector

functions.description:
Resets all user data and starts a fresh session.
 **Warning**: Only call this when a user logs out. Calling at the wrong time can cause split sessions.
This clears: - Session ID and super properties - User identification (sets new random distinct_id) - Cached data and consent settings
functions.title: reset

examples.name: reset on user logout
reset and generate new device ID
examples.code:
// reset and generate new device ID
posthog.reset(true)  // also resets device_id

functions.description: Resets the group properties for feature flags.
functions.title: resetGroupPropertiesForFlags

examples.code: posthog.resetGroupPropertiesForFlags()

functions.description: Resets only the group properties of the user currently logged in. Learn more about [groups](/docs/product-analytics/group-analytics)
functions.title: resetGroups

examples.code: posthog.resetGroups()

functions.description: Resets the person properties for feature flags.
functions.title: resetPersonPropertiesForFlags

examples.code: posthog.resetPersonPropertiesForFlags()

functions.description: returns a boolean indicating whether session recording is currently running
functions.title: sessionRecordingStarted

examples.name: Stop session recording if it's running

functions.description: Updates the configuration of the PostHog instance.
functions.title: set_config

examples.name: Generated example for set_config
examples.code:
// Generated example for set_config
posthog.set_config();

params.description: A dictionary of new configuration values to update
params.name: config

functions.description: Set override group properties for feature flags. This is used when dealing with new groups / where you don't want to wait for ingestion to update properties. Takes in an object, the key of which is the group type.
functions.title: setGroupPropertiesForFlags

examples.name: Set properties with reload
examples.code:
// Set properties with reload
posthog.setGroupPropertiesForFlags({'organization': { name: 'CYZ', employees: '11' } })

examples.name: Set properties without reload
examples.code:
// Set properties without reload
posthog.setGroupPropertiesForFlags({'organization': { name: 'CYZ', employees: '11' } }, false)

params.description: The properties to override, the key of which is the group type.
params.name: properties

params.description: Whether to reload feature flags.
params.name: reloadFeatureFlags

functions.description: Sets properties on the person profile associated with the current `distinct_id`. Learn more about [identifying users](/docs/product-analytics/identify)
functions.details: Updates user properties that are stored with the person profile in PostHog. If `person_profiles` is set to `identified_only` and no profile exists, this will create one.
functions.title: setPersonProperties

examples.name: set user properties
set properties

params.description: Optional: An associative array of properties to store about the user. Note: For feature flag evaluations, if the same key is present in the userPropertiesToSetOnce, it will be overwritten by the value in userPropertiesToSet.
params.name: userPropertiesToSet

params.description: Optional: An associative array of properties to store about the user. If property is previously set, this does not override that value.
params.name: userPropertiesToSetOnce

functions.description: Sometimes, you might want to evaluate feature flags using properties that haven't been ingested yet, or were set incorrectly earlier. You can do so by setting properties the flag depends on with these calls:
functions.title: setPersonPropertiesForFlags

examples.name: Set properties
examples.code:
// Set properties
posthog.setPersonPropertiesForFlags({'property1': 'value', property2: 'value2'})

examples.name: Set properties without reloading
examples.code:
// Set properties without reloading
posthog.setPersonPropertiesForFlags({'property1': 'value', property2: 'value2'}, false)

params.description: The properties to override.
params.name: properties

params.description: Whether to reload feature flags.
params.name: reloadFeatureFlags

functions.description: turns session recording on, and updates the config option `disable_session_recording` to false
functions.title: startSessionRecording

examples.name: Start and ignore controls
examples.code:
// Start and ignore controls
posthog.startSessionRecording(true)

examples.name: Start and override controls

params.description: optional boolean to override the default sampling behavior - ensures the next session recording to start will not be skipped by sampling or linked_flag config. `true` is shorthand for  sampling: true, linked_flag: true
params.name: override

functions.description: turns session recording off, and updates the config option disable_session_recording to true
functions.title: stopSessionRecording

examples.name: Stop session recording
examples.code:
// Stop session recording
posthog.stopSessionRecording()

functions.description: Removes a session super property from the current session.
functions.details: This will stop the property from being automatically included in future events for this session. The property is removed from sessionStorage.
functions.title: unregister_for_session

examples.name: remove a session property
examples.code:
// remove a session property
posthog.unregister_for_session('current_flow')

params.description: The name of the session super property to remove
params.name: property

functions.description: Removes a super property from persistent storage.
functions.details: This will stop the property from being automatically included in future events. The property will be permanently removed from the user's profile.
functions.title: unregister

examples.name: remove a super property
examples.code:
// remove a super property
posthog.unregister('plan_type')

params.description: The name of the super property to remove
params.name: property

functions.description: Opt the user in or out of an early access feature. [Learn more in the docs](/docs/feature-flags/early-access-feature-management#option-2-custom-implementation)
functions.title: updateEarlyAccessFeatureEnrollment

params.description: The key of the feature flag to update.
params.name: key

params.description: Whether the user is enrolled in the feature.
params.name: isEnrolled

params.description: The stage of the feature flag to update.
params.name: stage

properties.description: ActionStepStringMatching.Exact
properties.name: href_matching

properties.description: StringMatching.Exact
properties.name: text_matching

properties.description: StringMatching.Contains
properties.name: url_matching

properties.description: When set to true, autocapture will capture the text of any element that is cut or copied.
properties.name: capture_copied_text

properties.description:
List of CSS selectors to allow autocapture on e.g. ['[ph-capture]'] we consider the tree of elements from the root to the target element of the click event so for the tree div  div  button  svg and allow list config `['[id]']` we will capture the click if the click-target or its parents has any id
Everything is allowed when there's no allowlist
properties.name: css_selector_allowlist

properties.description: List of DOM events to allow autocapture on e.g. ['click', 'change', 'submit']
properties.name: dom_event_allowlist

properties.description:
List of DOM elements to allow autocapture on e.g. ['a', 'button', 'form', 'input', 'select', 'textarea', 'label']
We consider the tree of elements from the root to the target element of the click event so for the tree `div > div > button > svg` if the allowlist has `button` then we allow the capture when the `button` or the `svg` is the click target but not if either of the `div`s are detected as the click target
properties.name: element_allowlist

properties.description: Exclude certain element attributes from autocapture E.g. ['aria-label'] or [data-attr-pii]
properties.name: element_attribute_ignorelist

properties.description:
List of URLs to allow autocapture on, can be strings to match or regexes e.g. ['https://example.com', 'test.com/.*'] this is useful when you want to autocapture on specific pages only
if you set both url_allowlist and url_ignorelist, we check the allowlist first and then the ignorelist. the ignorelist can override the allowlist
properties.name: url_allowlist

properties.description:
List of URLs to not allow autocapture on, can be strings to match or regexes e.g. ['https://example.com', 'test.com/.*'] this is useful when you want to autocapture on most pages but not some specific ones
if you set both url_allowlist and url_ignorelist, we check the allowlist first and then the ignorelist. the ignorelist can override the allowlist
properties.name: url_ignorelist

properties.description: Optionally provide a sessionID, this is so that you can provide an existing sessionID here to continue a user's session across a domain or device. It MUST be: - unique to this user - a valid UUID v7 - the timestamp part must be = the timestamp of the first event in the session - the timestamp of the last event in the session must be  the timestamp part + 24 hours *
properties.name: sessionID

types.name: CapturedNetworkRequest

properties.description: key of queue, e.g. 'sessionRecording' vs 'event'
properties.name: _batchKey

properties.description: If set, overrides and disables config.properties_string_max_length
properties.name: _noTruncate

properties.description: Used to override the desired endpoint for the captured event
properties.name: _url

properties.description: Used when `$identify` is called Will set person properties but only once, it will NOT override previous values
properties.name: $set_once

properties.description: Used when `$identify` is called Will set person properties overriding previous values
properties.name: $set

properties.description: If set, skips the batched queue
properties.name: send_instantly

properties.description: If set, skips the client side rate limiting
properties.name: skip_client_rate_limiting

properties.description: If set, overrides the current timestamp
properties.name: timestamp

properties.description: If set, overrides the desired transport method
properties.name: transport

types.name: DeadClicksAutoCaptureConfig
ErrorEventArgs

properties.description:
ADVANCED: alters the bucket size for the token bucket mutation throttling Normally only altered alongside posthog support guidance. Accepts values between 0 and 100
10
properties.name: __exceptionRateLimiterBucketSize

properties.description:
ADVANCED: alters the refill rate for the token bucket mutation throttling Normally only altered alongside posthog support guidance. Accepts values between 0 and 100
1
properties.name: __exceptionRateLimiterRefillRate

properties.description:
Decide whether exceptions thrown by browser extensions should be captured
false
properties.name: captureExtensionExceptions

types.name: EvaluationReason
ExceptionAutoCaptureConfig
FeatureFlagDetail
FeatureFlagMetadata
FeatureFlagsCallback

properties.description:
How often to send batched data in `$heatmap_data` events If set to 0 or not set, sends using the default interval of 1 second
1000
properties.name: flush_interval_milliseconds

types.name: JsonType
types.example: string | number | boolean | null | undefined | JsonRecord | Array<JsonType>

types.name: NetworkRecordOptions

properties.description:
We observe very large values reported by the Chrome web vitals library These outliers are likely not real, useful values, and we exclude them You can set this to 0 in order to include all values, NB this is not recommended
15 * 60 * 1000 (15 minutes)
properties.name: __web_vitals_max_value

properties.description: Works with session replay to use the browser's native performance observer to capture performance metrics
properties.name: network_timing

properties.description:
By default all 4 metrics are captured You can set this config to restrict which metrics are captured e.g. ['CLS', 'FCP'] to only capture those two metrics NB setting this does not override whether the capture is enabled
['LCP', 'CLS', 'FCP', 'INP']
properties.name: web_vitals_allowed_metrics

properties.description:
We delay flushing web vitals metrics to reduce the number of events we send This is the maximum time we will wait before sending the metrics
5000
properties.name: web_vitals_delayed_flush_ms

properties.description: Use chrome's web vitals library to wrap fetch and capture web vitals
properties.name: web_vitals

properties.type: (name: string, value: any, expire_days?: number | null, cross_subdomain?: boolean, secure?: boolean, debug?: boolean) => void
properties.name: _set

properties.description: PREVIEW - MAY CHANGE WITHOUT WARNING - DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION A list of hostnames for which to inject PostHog tracing headers to all requests (X-POSTHOG-DISTINCT-ID, X-POSTHOG-SESSION-ID, X-POSTHOG-WINDOW-ID)
properties.name: __add_tracing_headers

properties.description: PREVIEW - MAY CHANGE WITHOUT WARNING - DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION Whether to use the new /flags/ endpoint
properties.name: __preview_flags_v2

properties.description: PREVIEW - MAY CHANGE WITHOUT WARNING - DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION Enables the new RemoteConfig approach to loading config instead of /flags?v=2&config=true
properties.name: __preview_remote_config

properties.description:
Stops from firing feature flag requests on first page load. Only requests feature flags when user identity or properties are updated, or you manually request for flags to be loaded.
false
properties.name: advanced_disable_feature_flags_on_first_load

properties.description:
Will keep /flags running, but without evaluating any feature flags. Useful for when you need to load the config data associated with the flags endpoint (e.g. /flags?v=2&config=true) without evaluating any feature flags. Most folks use this to save money on feature flag evaluation (by bootstrapping feature flags on the server side).
false
properties.name: advanced_disable_feature_flags

properties.description:
One of the very first things the PostHog library does when init() is called is make a request to the /flags endpoint on PostHog's backend. This endpoint contains information on how to run the PostHog library so events are properly received in the backend, and it also contains feature flag evaluation information for the current user.
This endpoint is required to run most features of this library. However, if you're not using any of the described features, you may wish to turn off the call completely to avoid an extra request and reduce resource usage on both the client and the server.
false
properties.name: advanced_disable_flags

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should disable toolbar metrics. This is our internal instrumentation for our toolbar in your website.
false
properties.name: advanced_disable_toolbar_metrics

properties.description:
When this is enabled, surveys will always be initialized, regardless of the /flags response or remote config settings. This is useful if you want to use surveys but disable all other flag-dependent functionality. Used internally for displaying external surveys without making a /flags request.
false
properties.name: advanced_enable_surveys

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should only evaluate feature flags for surveys. Useful for when you want to use this library to evaluate feature flags for surveys only but you have additional feature flags that you evaluate on the server side.
false
properties.name: advanced_only_evaluate_survey_feature_flags

properties.description:
URL of your PostHog instance.
'https://us.i.posthog.com'
properties.name: api_host

properties.description:
The transport method to use for API requests.
'fetch'
properties.name: api_transport

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should autocapture events. This setting does not affect capturing pageview events (see `capture_pageview`).
true
properties.name: autocapture

properties.description: This function or array of functions - if provided - are called immediately before sending data to the server. It allows you to edit data before it is sent, or choose not to send it all. if provided as an array the functions are called in the order they are provided any one function returning null means the event will not be sent
properties.name: before_send

properties.description:
An object containing the `distinctID`, `isIdentifiedID`, and `featureFlags` keys, where `distinctID` is a string, and `featureFlags` is an object of key-value pairs.
Since there is a delay between initializing PostHog and fetching feature flags, feature flags are not always available immediately. This makes them unusable if you want to do something like redirecting a user to a different page based on a feature flag.
You can, therefore, fetch the feature flags in your server and pre-fill them here, allowing PostHog to know the feature flag values immediately.
After the SDK fetches feature flags from PostHog, it will use those flag values instead of bootstrapped ones.
properties.name: bootstrap

properties.description: Determines whether to capture dead clicks.
properties.name: capture_dead_clicks

properties.description: Determines whether to capture exceptions.
properties.name: capture_exceptions

properties.description: Determines whether to capture heatmaps.
properties.name: capture_heatmaps

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should capture pageleave events. If set to `true`, it will capture pageleave events for all pages. If set to `'if_capture_pageview'`, it will only capture pageleave events if `capture_pageview` is also set to `true` or `'history_change'`.
'if_capture_pageview'
properties.name: capture_pageleave

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should capture pageview events automatically. Can be: - `true`: Capture regular pageviews (default) - `false`: Don't capture any pageviews - `'history_change'`: Only capture pageviews on history API changes (pushState, replaceState, popstate)
true
properties.name: capture_pageview

properties.description:
Determines whether to capture performance metrics. These include Network Timing and Web Vitals.
When `undefined`, fallback to the remote configuration. If `false`, neither network timing nor web vitals will work. If an object, that will override the remote configuration.
properties.name: capture_performance

properties.description:
Determines the key for the cookie / local storage used to store the information about whether users are opted in/out of capturing. When `null`, we used a key based on your token.
null
properties.name: consent_persistence_name

properties.description:
Determines the number of days to store cookies for.
365
properties.name: cookie_expiration

properties.description:
Enables cookieless mode. In this mode, PostHog will not set any cookies, or use session or local storage. User identity is handled by generating a privacy-preserving hash on PostHog's servers. - 'always' - enable cookieless mode immediately on startup, use this if you do not intend to show a cookie banner - 'on_reject' - enable cookieless mode only if the user rejects cookies, use this if you want to show a cookie banner. If the user accepts cookies, cookieless mode will not be used, and PostHog will use cookies and local storage as usual.
Note that you MUST enable cookieless mode in your PostHog project's settings, otherwise all your cookieless events will be ignored. We plan to remove this requirement in the future.
properties.name: cookieless_mode

properties.description:
Determines if cookie should be set on the top level domain (example.com). If PostHog-js is loaded on a subdomain (test.example.com), and `cross_subdomain_cookie` is set to false, it'll set the cookie on the subdomain only (test.example.com).
NOTE: It will be set to `false` if we detect that the domain is a subdomain of a platform that is excluded from cross-subdomain cookie setting. The current list of excluded platforms is `herokuapp.com`, `vercel.app`, and `netlify.app`.
properties.name: cross_subdomain_cookie

properties.description: Used to extend the list of user agents that are blocked by default.
properties.name: custom_blocked_useragents

properties.description: Used to extend the list of campaign parameters that are saved by default.
properties.name: custom_campaign_params

properties.description:
Custom list of personal data properties to mask.
E.g. if you added `email` to this list, then any `email` property in the URL will be masked. https://www.example.com/login?email=john.doe%40example.com = https://www.example.com/login?email=
[]
properties.name: custom_personal_data_properties

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should be in debug mode. You can enable this to get more detailed logging.
You can also enable this on your website by appending `?__posthog_debug=true` at the end of your URL You can also call `posthog.debug()` in your code to enable debug mode
false
properties.name: debug

properties.description:
Configuration defaults for breaking changes. When set to a specific date, enables new default behaviors that were introduced on that date.
- `'unset'`: Use legacy default behaviors - `'2025-05-24'`: Use updated default behaviors (e.g. capture_pageview defaults to 'history_change')
'unset'
properties.name: defaults

properties.description:
Determines whether to disable compression when sending events to the server. WARNING: Should only be used for testing. Could negatively impact performance.
false
properties.name: disable_compression

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should disable any external dependency loading. This will prevent PostHog from requesting any external scripts such as those needed for Session Replay, Surveys or Site Apps.
false
properties.name: disable_external_dependency_loading

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should disable persistence. If set to `true`, the library will not save any data to the browser. It will also delete any data previously saved to the browser.
false
properties.name: disable_persistence

properties.description:
Determines whether to disable scroll properties. These allow you to keep track of how far down someone scrolled in your website.
false
properties.name: disable_scroll_properties

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should disable session recording.
false
properties.name: disable_session_recording

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should disable automatic display of surveys. If this is true, popup or widget surveys will not be shown when display conditions are met.
false
properties.name: disable_surveys_automatic_display

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should disable all surveys functionality.
false
properties.name: disable_surveys

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should disable web experiments.
Currently disabled while we're in BETA. It will be toggled to `true` in a future release.
true
properties.name: disable_web_experiments

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should enable recording console logs. When undefined, it falls back to the remote config setting.
undefined
properties.name: enable_recording_console_log

properties.description: Determines the error tracking options.
properties.name: error_tracking

properties.description:
Sets timeout for fetching feature flags
3000
properties.name: feature_flag_request_timeout_ms

properties.description:
Used when sending data via `fetch`, use with care. This is intentionally meant to be used with NextJS `fetch`
Incorrect `cache` usage may cause out-of-date data for feature flags, actions tracking, etc. See https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/functions/fetch#fetchurl-options
properties.name: fetch_options

properties.description: Function to get the device ID. This doesn't usually need to be set, but can be useful if you want to use a custom device ID.
properties.name: get_device_id

properties.description: Used to set-up external integrations with PostHog data - such as session replays, distinct id, etc.
properties.name: integrations

properties.description: A function to be called once the PostHog scripts have loaded successfully.
properties.name: loaded

properties.description:
Prevent autocapture from capturing any attribute names on elements.
false
properties.name: mask_all_element_attributes

properties.description:
Prevent autocapture from capturing `textContent` on elements.
false
properties.name: mask_all_text

properties.description: Mask personal data properties from the current URL. This will mask personal data properties such as advertising IDs (gclid, fbclid, etc.), and you can also add custom properties to mask with `custom_personal_data_properties`.   false
properties.name: mask_personal_data_properties

properties.description:
The name this instance will be identified by. You don't need to set this most of the time, but can be useful if you have several Posthog instances running at the same time.
'posthog'
properties.name: name

properties.description: A function that is called when a request to the PostHog API fails.
properties.name: on_request_error

properties.description:
Determines if users should be opted in to site apps.
false
properties.name: opt_in_site_apps

properties.description:
Determines if users should be opted out of PostHog tracking by default, requiring additional logic to opt them into capturing by calling `posthog.opt_in_capturing()`.
false
properties.name: opt_out_capturing_by_default

properties.description:
Determines where we'll save the information about whether users are opted out of capturing.
'localStorage'
properties.name: opt_out_capturing_persistence_type

properties.description:
Determines if users should be opted out of browser data storage by this PostHog instance by default, requiring additional logic to opt them into capturing by calling `posthog.opt_in_capturing()`.
false
properties.name: opt_out_persistence_by_default

properties.description:
Determines if users should be opted out of user agent filtering such as googlebot or other bots. If this is set to `true`, PostHog will set `$browser_type` to either `bot` or `browser` for all events, but will process all events as if they were from a browser.
false
properties.name: opt_out_useragent_filter

properties.description:
The name for the super properties persistent store
''
properties.name: persistence_name

properties.description:
Determines how PostHog stores information about the user. See [persistence](https://posthog.com/docs/libraries/js#persistence) for details.
'localStorage+cookie'
properties.name: persistence

properties.description:
You can control whether events from PostHog-js have person processing enabled with the `person_profiles` config setting. There are three options: - `person_profiles: 'always'` - we will process persons data for all events - `person_profiles: 'never'` - we won't process persons for any event. This means that anonymous users will not be merged once they sign up or login, so you lose the ability to create funnels that track users from anonymous to identified. All events (including `$identify`) will be sent with `$process_person_profile: False`. - `person_profiles: 'identified_only'` _(default)_ - we will only process persons when you call `posthog.identify`, `posthog.alias`, `posthog.setPersonProperties`, `posthog.group`, `posthog.setPersonPropertiesForFlags` or `posthog.setGroupPropertiesForFlags` Anonymous users won't get person profiles.
'identified_only'
properties.name: person_profiles

properties.description: A function to be called when a script is being loaded. This can be used to modify the script before it is loaded. This is useful for adding a nonce to the script, for example.
properties.name: prepare_external_dependency_script

properties.description: A function to be called when a stylesheet is being loaded. This can be used to modify the stylesheet before it is loaded. This is useful for adding a nonce to the stylesheet, for example.
properties.name: prepare_external_dependency_stylesheet

properties.description:
Determines the maximum length of the properties string that can be sent with capture calls.
65535
properties.name: properties_string_max_length

properties.description:
A list of properties that should never be sent with capture calls.
[]
properties.name: property_denylist

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should capture rage clicks.
true
properties.name: rageclick

properties.description: Client side rate limiting
properties.name: rate_limiting

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should batch requests to the PostHog API.
true
properties.name: request_batching

properties.description: A list of headers that should be sent with requests to the PostHog API.
properties.name: request_headers

properties.description: Used to change the behavior of the request queue. This is an advanced feature and should be used with caution.
properties.name: request_queue_config

properties.description: Determines whether PostHog should respect the Do Not Track header when computing consent in `ConsentManager`.
properties.name: respect_dnt

properties.description: Determines whether PostHog should save marketing parameters. These are `utm_*` paramaters and friends.
properties.name: save_campaign_params

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should save referrer information.
true
properties.name: save_referrer

properties.description: Let the pageview scroll stats use a custom css selector for the root element, e.g. `main` It will use `window.document.documentElement` if not specified.
properties.name: scroll_root_selector

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should use secure cookies. If this is `true`, PostHog cookies will be marked as secure, meaning they will only be transmitted over HTTPS.
window.location.protocol === 'https:'
properties.name: secure_cookie

properties.description: The segment analytics object.
properties.name: segment

properties.description:
Determines the session idle timeout in seconds. Any new event that's happened after this timeout will create a new session.
30 * 60 -- 30 minutes
properties.name: session_idle_timeout_seconds

properties.description: Determines the session recording options.
properties.name: session_recording

properties.description:
Sets timeout for fetching surveys
10000
properties.name: surveys_request_timeout_ms

properties.description: The token for your PostHog project. It should NOT be provided manually in the config, but rather passed as the first parameter to `posthog.init()`.
properties.name: token

properties.description:
If using a reverse proxy for `api_host` then this should be the actual PostHog app URL (e.g. https://us.posthog.com). This ensures that links to PostHog point to the correct host.
null
properties.name: ui_host

properties.description:
Determines whether PostHog should upgrade old cookies. If set to `true`, the library will check for a cookie from our old js library and import super properties from it, then the old cookie is deleted. This option only works in the initialization, so make sure you set it when you create the library.
false
properties.name: upgrade

types.name: Properties
types.example:
// Properties is a Record<string, Property> 
// Below are PostHog's default properties, you can add your own properties during capture
{
    $timestamp: '2024-05-29T17:32:07.202Z',
    $os: 'Mac OS X',
    $os_version: '10.15.7',
    $browser: 'Chrome',
    $browser_version: '125',
    $device_type: 'Desktop',
    $current_url: 'https://example.com/page',
    $host: 'example.com',
    $pathname: '/page',
    $screen_height: 1080,
    $screen_width: 1920,
    $viewport_height: 950,
    $viewport_width: 1903,
    $lib: 'web',
    $lib_version: '1.31.0',
    $search_engine: 'google',
    $referrer: 'https://google.com',
    $referring_domain: 'www.google.com',
    $active_feature_flags: ['beta_feature'],
    $event_type: 'click',
    $utm_source: 'newsletter',
    $utm_medium: 'email',
    $utm_campaign: 'product_launch',
    $utm_term: 'new+product',
    $utm_content: 'logolink',
    $gclid: 'TeSter-123',
    $gad_source: 'google_ads',
    $gclsrc: 'dsa',
    $dclid: 'testDclid123',
    $wbraid: 'testWbraid123',
    $gbraid: 'testGbraid123',
    $fbclid: 'testFbclid123',
    $msclkid: 'testMsclkid123',
    $twclid: 'testTwclid123',
    $li_fat_id: 'testLiFatId123',
    $mc_cid: 'testMcCid123',
    $igshid: 'testIgshid123',
    $ttclid: 'testTtclid123',
    $plugins_succeeded: ['GeoIP (56578)'],
    $plugins_failed: ['plugin3'],
    $plugins_deferred: ['plugin4'],
    $ip: '192.168.1.1'
}

types.name: Property

properties.description: key of queue, e.g. 'sessionRecording' vs 'event'
properties.name: batchKey

properties.description:
Whether we should use a custom endpoint for analytics
endpoint: "/e"
properties.name: analytics

properties.description: If set, disables autocapture
properties.name: autocapture_opt_out

properties.description: This is currently in development and may have breaking changes without a major version bump
properties.name: autocaptureExceptions

properties.description: Whether to capture dead clicks
properties.name: captureDeadClicks

properties.description: originally capturePerformance was replay only and so boolean true is equivalent to  network_timing: true  now capture performance can be separately enabled within replay and as a standalone web vitals tracker people can have them enabled separately they work standalone but enhance each other TODO: deprecate this so we make a new config that doesn't need this explanation
properties.name: capturePerformance

properties.description: Whether to only capture identified users by default
properties.name: defaultIdentifiedOnly

properties.description:
Whether the `$elements_chain` property should be sent as a string or as an array
false
properties.name: elementsChainAsString

properties.description: Error tracking configuration options
properties.name: errorTracking

properties.description: Indicates if the team has any flags enabled (if not we don't need to load them)
properties.name: hasFeatureFlags

properties.description: Whether heatmaps are enabled
properties.name: heatmaps

properties.description: Whether the user is authenticated
properties.name: isAuthenticated

properties.description: Session recording configuration options
properties.name: sessionRecording

properties.description: List of site apps with their IDs and URLs
properties.name: siteApps

properties.description: Supported compression algorithms
properties.name: supportedCompression

properties.description: Whether surveys are enabled
properties.name: surveys

properties.description: Parameters for the toolbar
properties.name: toolbarParams

properties.description: deprecated, moved to toolbarParams
properties.name: toolbarVersion

properties.description: ADVANCED - alters the frequency which PostHog sends events to the server. generally speaking this is only set when apps have automatic page refreshes, or very short visits. Defaults to 3 seconds when not set Allowed values between 250 and 5000
properties.name: flush_interval_ms

types.name: SessionIdChangedCallback
SessionRecordingCanvasOptions

properties.description:
ADVANCED: alters the bucket size for the token bucket mutation throttling Normally only altered alongside posthog support guidance. Accepts values between 0 and 100
100

10

true

1000 * 60 * 5 (5 minutes)
